1d055021684d04f9186391c2d9ac850e0d0819f76140e4fc84ed","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://a19c7bae07330e6d7904a0a21cf0ab0067ef096b66c1653a2e012801a931c5b9","dweb:/ipfs/QmckpvSuLx8UL8zfVzAtN6ZRxyXHUSVqqz2JwYZ2jrK58h"]},"vendor/openzeppelin-solidity/v4.8.3/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9ec0d82ee53d4137be44f1f38f9a82d0d3a2027b3b8b226a5a90e4ee76e926d6","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f783b453420dee16bb4f0839e3d2485d753d2dcd317adbeecb7e510c39563f57","dweb:/ipfs/QmUd4BeCaw6ZujaYvvMrCn2BNqmiP4bt4eA9rxiXY5od5E"]}},"version":1}

getBlessProgress((address,bytes32)).details: This is a helper method for offchain code so efficiency is not really a concern.

returns.accumulatedWeight: sum of weights of voters, will be zero if voting took place with an older config version
returns.blessVoteAddrs: addresses of voters, will be empty if voting took place with an older config version
returns.blessed: will be accurate regardless of when voting took place

getCurseProgress(bytes16).details: This is a helper method for offchain code so efficiency is not really a concern.

returns.accumulatedWeight: the accumulated weight of all voters with an active vote to curse who are part of the current config
returns.curseVoteAddrs: the curseVoteAddr of each voter with an active vote to curse
returns.cursed: might be true even if the owner has no active vote and accumulatedWeight < curseWeightThreshold, due to a retained curse from a prior config
returns.cursesHashes: the i-th value is the curses hash of curseVoteAddrs[i]

getRecordedCurseRelatedOps(uint256,uint2.details: This is a helper method for offchain code so efficiency is not really a concern.Returns s_recordedCurseRelatedOps[offset:offset+limit].

getRecordedCurseRelatedOpsCount().details: This is a helper method for offchain code to know what arguments to use for getRecordedCurseRelatedOps.

params.subject: To check whether a particular chain is cursed, set to bytes16(uint128(chainSelector)).

params.taggedRoots: A tagged root is hashed as `keccak256(abi.encode(taggedRoot.commitStore /* address */, taggedRoot.root /* bytes32 */))`.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

getConfigDetails().notice: Config version might be incremented for many reasons, including the lifting of a curse, or a regular config change.

getCursedSubjectsCount().notice: Returns the number of subjects that are currently cursed.

getPermaBlessedCommitStores().notice: Any tagged root with a commit store included in this array will be considered automatically blessed.

isBlessed((address,bytes32)).notice: Callers MUST NOT cache the return value as a blessed tagged root could become unblessed.

isCursed().notice: Iff there is an active global or legacy curse, this function returns true.

isCursed(bytes16).notice: Iff there is an active global curse, or an active curse for `subject`, this function returns true.

ownerCurse(bytes16,bytes16[]).notice: Enables the owner to immediately have the system enter the cursed state.

ownerRemoveThenAddPermaBlessedCommitStor.notice: The ordering of parameters is important. First come the commit stores to remove, then the commit stores to add.

ownerResetBlessVotes((address,bytes32)[].notice: Can be called by the owner to remove unintentionally voted or even blessed tagged roots in a recovery scenario. The owner must ensure that there are no in-flight transactions by RMN nodes voting for any of the taggedRoots before calling this function, as such in-flight transactions could lead to the roots becoming re-blessed shortly after the call to this function, contrary to the original intention.

ownerUnvoteToCurse((address,(bytes16,byt.notice: Enables the owner to remove curse votes. After the curse votes are removed, this function will check whether the curse is still valid and restore the uncursed state if possible. This function also enables the owner to lift a curse created through ownerCurse.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.

unvoteToCurse((bytes16,bytes28)[]).notice: Can be called by a curser to remove unintentional votes to curse. We expect this to be called very rarely, e.g. in case of a bug in the offchain code causing false voteToCurse calls.Should be called from curser's corresponding curseVoteAddr.

voteToBless((address,bytes32)[]).notice: Tagged roots which are already (voted to be) blessed are skipped and emit corresponding events. In case the call has no effect, i.e., all passed tagged roots are skipped, the function reverts with a `VoteToBlessNoop`.

voteToCurse(bytes16,bytes16[]).notice: A vote to curse is appropriate during unhealthy blockchain conditions (eg. finality violations).

documentation.text:
@dev This function is to _ONLY_ be called in order to determine if a curse should become active upon a
 vote-to-curse, or a curse should be deactivated upon an owner-unvote-to-curse.
 Other reasons for a curse to be active, which are not covered here:
 1. Cursedness is retained from a prior config.
 2. The curse weight threshold was met at some point, which activated a curse, and enough voters unvoted to curse
 such that the curse weight threshold is no longer met.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RMN.Voter storage ref[] storage ref
struct RMN.Voter storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text: @notice Thrown when subjects are not a strictly increasing monotone sequence.

@notice Can be called by the owner to remove unintentionally voted or even blessed tagged roots in a recovery
 scenario. The owner must ensure that there are no in-flight transactions by RMN nodes voting for any of the
 taggedRoots before calling this function, as such in-flight transactions could lead to the roots becoming
 re-blessed shortly after the call to this function, contrary to the original intention.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct RMN.CurseVoteProgress storage pointer) view returns (bool)
struct RMN.RecordedCurseRelatedOp storage ref[] storage ref
function (struct RMN.RecordedCurseRelatedOp storage ref[] storage pointer,struct RMN.RecordedCurseRelatedOp storage ref)
function (enum RMN.Privilege,uint32,address,struct RMN.UnvoteToCurseRequest memory,bool,struct RMN.CurserRecord storage pointer,struct RMN.CurseVoteProgress storage pointer) returns (bool,bool)

documentation.text:
@notice A vote to curse is appropriate during unhealthy blockchain conditions
 (eg. finality violations).
